actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to allow a deduction with respect to the exhaustion of geothermal steam and geothermal resources.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow to a taxpayer holding an economic interest in a geothermal energy property a tax deduction amounting to 22 percent of the gross income from such property, excluding from such gross income an amount equal to any rents or royalties paid or incurred by the taxpayer in respect to such property. Requires that regulations issued by the Secretary of the Treasury also grant the option to deduct as expenses intangible drilling and development costs in the case of wells drilled for geothermal steam and associated geothermal resources.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to allow a deduction with respect to the exhaustion of geothermal steam and geothermal resources.
